instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
threads.message:
Hi,
Need help with a board random backlight issue. First time i started it worked fine. Restart and no backlight. Now it's no backlight always. Checked the following and noticed 2.8v missing at  PWM Pin voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR>.  
Measured the VIN voltage through capacitor <CAPACITOR>C7710</CAPACITOR> - 5V.
Measured the VDDIO voltage through capacitor <CAPACITOR>C7711</CAPACITOR> - 3.3V
Measured the EN Pin voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor <RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR> - 2.8V.
Measured the PWM Pin voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> -  Missing
Measured the SCLK voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor <RESISTOR>R7753</RESISTOR> - 3.3V
Measured the SDA voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor <RESISTOR>R7757</RESISTOR> - 3.3V.. 
Replaced <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> - No change..

What next?

threads.title: MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
threads.message: Another thing i noticed... With a flashlight at the back i can see the machine boot but it is extremely slow and keyboard and trackpad both not working. Power on off button is unresponsive and even with a battery connected it boots up without pressing the power key. Am i looking at SMC issue..

threads.title: MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
threads.message:
Did you check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal?
Tried another LIO board/flex and trackpad?
Checked XW7720 integrity?

You didn't mention in any moment the voltage at pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> measured on <RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 0.65 mv. Missing...Changed the LIO board and flex cable. Swapped the board on a working machine and same issue. XW7720 check is pending as i will need to remove <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> Pin 1 and 2 both show 0v. In the meantime, if this helps...

threads.title: MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
threads.message:
No need to remove <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, unless you already detect corrosion underneath.
Scratch the smll area near A5 ball.

Do you have now 3V at <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
threads.message: Removed <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and XW7720 is fine. <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> pin 2 to <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> A5 link is perfect. Anything else needs to be checked while <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> is removed? Ordered a new <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> and should take a couple of days.

threads.title: MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
threads.message: You should fix <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> problem, before touching <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>...

threads.title: MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
threads.message: What do i check for some help will be nice... But will have to wait till i get the new chip.

threads.title: MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
threads.message:
Replace <RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR>.
Check J9500 for corrosion on corresponding pin.
Still no backlight if LIO flex is disconnected?
At least <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> must go high.

threads.title: MAcbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue.
threads.message: Replaced <RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR> and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and got the backlight. PRAM & SMC reset took care of the slow booting. Thank u.
